courseTitle: Number and Operations for PK-8 Mathematics Specialists
courseDescription: This course will meet the requirements of students in the Master of Science in Education: PK-8 Mathematics Specialist Endorsement Program, and cannot be used for credit toward any degree offered by the Department of Mathematics and Statistics. The course introduces students to a number of topics in PK-8 mathematics and related pedagogical methods. Acknowledging that learning with understanding occurs through a process of establishing a solid knowledge base upon which to build, students will explore the many and varied ways in which PK-8 students may develop number sense. The focus will be upon the development of best practices for teaching mathematics. This requires that the student have knowledge of the content, use a variety of pedagogical approaches, and be able to select and utilize appropriate manipulatives and technological resources that will foster PK-8 student understanding.
Technical and Digital Skills: Development of best practices for teaching mathematics
Selection and utilization of appropriate manipulatives
Integration of technological resources in teaching
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of mathematical concepts to PK-8 students
Understanding and acknowledging the varied learning processes of PK-8 students
Promotion of number sense development in students
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis and understanding of PK-8 mathematics topics
Development of strategies to foster student understanding of mathematics
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organization of instructional materials and resources
Planning and execution of effective teaching strategies

courseTitle: Geometry and Measurement for PK-8 Mathematics Specialists
courseDescription: This course will meet the requirements of students in the Master of Science in Education: PK-8 Mathematics Specialist Endorsement Program, and cannot be used for credit toward any degree offered by the Department of Mathematics and Statistics. The course introduces students to a number of topics in PK-8 mathematics and related pedagogical methods. Following a "concrete-to-abstract" developmental learning approach, students will explore the mathematical concepts of measurement and geometry in grades PK-8. Emphasis will be placed upon measurement and geometry content knowledge as well as the pedagogical knowledge specific to mathematics teaching and learning. Students will also learn to use appropriate technology.
Technical and Digital Skills: Using relevant technology for mathematics teaching
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Communication of mathematical concepts to PK-8 students
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Developing solutions for mathematical problems in measurement and geometry
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading mathematics learning in a PK-8 setting

courseTitle: Rational Numbers and Proportional Reasoning for PK-8 Mathematics Specialists
courseDescription: This course will meet the requirements of students in the Master of Science in Education: PK-8 Mathematics Specialist Endorsement Program, and cannot be used for credit toward any degree offered by the Department of Mathematics and Statistics. The course introduces students to a number of topics in PK-8 mathematics and related pedagogical methods. It is designed to engage participants in constructing relational understanding between theoretical development of mathematics and students' learning of mathematics in the content strands of rational numbers and proportional reasoning. Students will learn how to select and use manipulatives to connect the concrete phase of mathematical learning to the abstract, symbolic phase. Various technologies will be integrated throughout the course as tools to enhance teaching and student understanding.
Technical and Digital Skills: Use of manipulatives for mathematical learning
Connecting concrete and abstract phases of mathematical learning
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Relating theoretical mathematics to student learning
Constructing relational understanding between theory and practice
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Selecting appropriate teaching tools and methods
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing the learning process of PK-8 students

courseTitle: Probability and Statistics for PK-8 Mathematics Specialists
courseDescription: This course will meet the requirements of students in the Master of Science in Education: PK-8 Mathematics Specialist Endorsement Program, and cannot be used for credit toward any degree offered by the Department of Mathematics and Statistics. The course introduces students to a number of topics in PK-8 mathematics and related pedagogical methods. It will focus on the content and processes that support the PK-8 students' learning of probability and statistics. Instruction will cover data collection, display, and analysis as well as the development of a fundamental understanding of probabilistic structures. These structures will be related to real world problem solving and hands-on activities. Technology will be integrated throughout the course to illustrate mathematical concepts, facilitate students exploration, and to make and test hypotheses.
Technical and Digital Skills: Usage of technology to illustrate mathematical concepts
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Relating mathematical structures to real world problems
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Hands-on activities related to probability and statistics
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Integration of technology into learning processes

courseTitle: Algebra and Functions for PK-8 Mathematics Specialists
courseDescription: This course will meet the requirements of students in the Master of Science in Education: PK-8 Mathematics Specialist Endorsement Program and cannot be used for credit toward any degree offered by the Department of Mathematics and Statistics. The course introduces students to algebraic topics in PK-12 mathematics and related pedagogical methods. Topics will focus on making connections between arithmetic and algebra and transitioning concrete arithmetic thinking to abstract algebraic thinking. Technology will be included  to enhance students' algebraic understanding and sense making.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of algebraic topics in PK-12 mathematics
Use of technology to enhance algebraic understanding
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Making connections between arithmetic and algebra
Transitioning from concrete arithmetic thinking to abstract algebraic thinking
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning and implementing pedagogical methods for teaching algebra
Managing the transition from arithmetic to algebraic thinking
